title: 'Don't you dare hide it away' - Race walker Tom Bosworth urges those with mental health issues to talk after claiming seventh at World Championships
text:
Tom Bosworth has urged anyone going through mental health problems “don’t you dare hide it away” after finishing seventh in the World Championships 20km race walk, less than a year after twice considering taking his own life.

Bosworth, Britain’s only openly gay track and field athlete, says an Olympic medal is a possibility next year after exceeding his own expectations in Doha following an injury-hit season.

Yet he came perilously close to not being in a position to make the British team when a spell of depression late last year led him to consider taking his own life.

With professional psychiatric help, Bosworth is now in a far better place and he paid tribute to those who had helped him through the difficult period after battling the Doha heat to finish seventh in the 20km race walk in the early hours of Saturday.

“There are so many people watching at home, so many people cheering me on and my family have really been through it this past year because of me, so I am sorry about that,” he said.
